article.title: Colorimetric Calibration of a Digital Camera

choices: Incident light spectra of grayscale filters measured by a camera.
Declared spectral response curves for red, green, and blue camera filters.
Calculated spectra of incoming light reaching the red camera channel.
Calibration curves for green camera pixels lying in the same column.
Light spectra of grayscale filters measured by a fiber spectrophotometer.
The influence of RGB camera filters on incident light spectra.
Total number of photons reaching different camera pixels for various grayscale filters.
Relationship between pixel intensity and grayscale filter number for different camera pixels.
The principle of the Bayer mask used in digital cameras.
The variation in quantum efficiency across different wavelengths for a camera sensor.
Calculated spectra of incoming light reaching a specific camera color channel.
The distribution of pixel intensities in a calibrated image.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Algorithm 1, the formula `A(i) = integrateSpectrum(wSp)` calculates:
choices: The average number of photons reaching each pixel.
The total number of photons reaching the specific color channel for a given gray filter.
The slope of the linear section of the calibration curve for a specific pixel.
The difference in intensity between two consecutive gray filter images.
